title: IP Address
subtext: Unique identifier for devices on a network
author: KrishDave

description.title: IP Address
texts: An IP (Internet Protocol) address is a unique set of numbers assigned to each device connected to a network, allowing devices to communicate over the internet.
There are two versions: IPv4, which uses four sets of numbers like 192.168.1.1, and IPv6, which has a longer format such as 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.
